module.p: beul is a masculine simple common noun, with slenderised genitive singular and nominative/dative form beòil.

air bheul can be used to mark prospective aspect about to, on the verge/point of, though mainly in older texts –
Tha iad air bheul a dhol ann. They are on the verge/point of going.
Tha sè ceud bliadhna air bheul a bhi seachad bho’n là ud a chuir Eideard Brus a chòmhrag dheireannach air aonach Faich-aird.
td. 66
“C’ àite ’bheil sibh a’ dol an déigh so?” dh’ fheòraich e. “Bha sinn air bheul tilleadh dhachaidh,” fhreagair mi.
We were about to return home. td. 97
cf. Other markers of prospective aspect – gu(s), an impis, air lunn, air thuar (evidential).
